project.teaser: Building Gender+ Equality Through Gender+ Budgeting For Institutional Transformation (Budget-It) is a three-year project designed to use gender+ budgeting to transform institutions to advance inclusive gender+ equality and enhance the reputation, inclusiveness, and research...
project.objective:
Building Gender+ Equality Through Gender+ Budgeting For Institutional Transformation (Budget-It) is a three-year project designed to use gender+ budgeting to transform institutions to advance inclusive gender+ equality and enhance the reputation, inclusiveness, and research excellence of the widening countries of Bosnia, Serbia and Turkey assisted by leading university counterparts in Italy and Spain. Budget-It will use of gender+ budgeting as a tool to move past the current stagnation surrounding gender+ equality. GEPs are often implemented without the required commitment of resources and the allocation of resources often remaining unexamined with institutional budgets reinforcing gender+ inequalities including inequities among women. The integration of gender+ budgeting into GEPs will ensure resources are distributed in an equitable and intersectional way. Partners will identify at least three intersections so that GEPs are both tailored and inclusive. By the end of the project, partner institutions will have produced an integrated, inclusive gender+ equality plan and gender+ budget (GEP-GB).
The consortium, five universities and four municipalities, will ensure the transfer of theory to practice and for knowledge to move beyond the walls of academia to create greater institutional and societal transformation. Municipalities, through the provision of services, impact the lives of many thousands and as such provides the opportunity to create a wider space in the public sphere for gender+ equality.
All three of the project’s widening country partners struggle with rising tides of anti-gender+ and ethno-religious nationalism. The slow mainstreaming of these anti-gender+ and nationalist discourses pose a threat to gains made towards equality and Budget-It represents an opportunity to reinforce and support institutionalisation and implementation of intersectional gender+ equality measures including a gender+ budget to ensure equity in the use of resources.
project.title: Building Gender Equality through gender budgeting for Institutional Transformation
project.keywords: gender equality plans, gender budget, intersectionality

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Project management handbook
result.description: A Project Management Handbook - guidelines for the implementation of the project, certain rules to be followed in social media and public media, and specific templates such as templates for reports and publications to provide relevant information to partners from the start of the project.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: At the project kick-off meeting, the consortium will choose a member to act as the data management protection officer to guide partners in the proper handling of all project data. The data management protection officer will then lead the consortium on creating a more detailed DMP and regularly reviewed and updated throughout the lifespan of the project. This task also includes the implementation of monitoring and reporting on RDM and Open Science actions to ensure that a FAIR (findable, accessible, interoperable and reusable) Data Management Plan and project

result.title: Report on focus groups used in GEP design
result.description: Report which outlines the focus groups results and perspective of GEP design.

result.title: Ethics plan
result.description: This Task ensures the alignment of the project’s implementation with ethical standards and requirements deriving from European Legislation (i.e., right of privacy), the Horizon Europe prog. (i.e., do-no- significant harm principle etc.), the GDPR and the ALLEA European Code of Conduct for Research Integrity.

result.title: Gender Equality Plans at Universities in Turkey

details.journalTitle: About Gender International Journal of Gender Studies

result.title: Primary data collection template
result.description: This document will consider all the gender+ data from universities and municipalities. How and what kind of data should be content and what is needed should be defined

result.title: Report on establishment of communication outlets: visual identity, promotional materials and stationery, website and social media accounts
result.description: Report which outlines the social media accounts, the website and all the promotional materials to be used during the project.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination, Exploitation and Sustainability Plan
result.description: A plan that outlines all the communication, dissemination, exploitation and sustainability strategies and activities for the project.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
